88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:49): Chrome is really excellent about not giving people unneeded choices.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (18:49): "users don't change defaults" isn't the same as "choice is bad"

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:50): That's one of the great things about it.  They don't say "Well, status bars are cluttery but some people like them, so let's make it an option."  They find a compromise that works well for everyone.
3cd30a070a8cd420f1a52db2a8b12754 (18:50): just a few minutes ago people were comparing the number of menus they had in their browsers
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:50): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, it does mean that you should never have a choice as a substitute for putting work into finding just the right default.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:51): "Give the users a choice" is often a way to avoid making a decision.
3cd30a070a8cd420f1a52db2a8b12754 (18:51): Chrome has done well, which is why I gave it to my mum. She can type whatever she likes in that box and it'll browse the web for her
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (18:51): that is indeed a pathology that is common in open source projects
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:51): Since it shuts up all the people who don't like the default, since they're just told to change it.
3cd30a070a8cd420f1a52db2a8b12754 (18:51): But then I use Linux and Opera, I like the other side of the scale
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:51): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, not in closed-source projects?  I can name you examples from Windows, for sure . . .

I'm still trying to figure out how to make Document Viewer my default PDF reader instead of scribus.  The latter isn't even installed anymore AFAICT.
